comments.commentBody: "What goes around comes around" - it is a fitting end for a person who instigated so much violence against so many innocent people.  It seems any form of extremism breeds violence - be it a Christian or a Muslim faith. Maybe, just maybe, the time for peace may be near.

While American drone attacks were focused on Pakistani caves and deserts based on leads from Pakistan, Osama was living happily in his multimillion dollar custom built house with his wives just a mile away from the Pakistani military academy.Pakistan military and ISI effectively shielded him for more than a decade.America had to spend million of dollars just to catch one single guy.They still have Ayman al Zawahiri and other terrorists. Inspite of this America gave $3 billion dollar economic aid to Pakistan last year and another $3 billion this year. Unfortunately this game will go on with Pakistan. We are suckers.

To paraphrase Townes Van Zandt:

All the Pakistanis say
They could have had him any day
They only let him go so long
Out of kindness, I suppose.

Now it's clear that no matter what's happening or going to happen in the Arab (or by extension the Muslim) world the real objective is the INCAPACITATING of Israel. Hamas warming-up to and reconciling with PLO, Egypt now allying with Iran and so forth only serve to remind that Israel may have to rely not just on military (even nuclear) superiority. With Iranian or others' missiles (potentially nuclear-tipped) able to reach even the heartland of Israel as well as the fact that enemies of Israel can by sheer weight of numbers overwhelm Israel and considering that Israel's traditional allies may be lured and influenced by the power of oil-money (which Israel unfortunately doesn't have) and resultant lucrative business deals to forsake and even resort to to arm-twisting Israel, it's only logical that Israel may now have to resort to superiority in cyber-warfare in order to survive.
It is chilling to think that were some who wanted to "shut" the government down while planning for this mission was under way.

I think Pakistan is heading for civil war just like Libya and Syria, it is just a matter of time.

Only thing worst about Pakistan, it is a nuclear weapons country, so watch out India.

In my eyes, President Obama earned his stripes as Commander-in-Chief today.
Kudos to him, and esp the Navy SEALS for the courage and calmness in face of intense pressure.
All the more incredble, since I watched him just Saturday, at the WH correspondents' dinner, all cool as a cucumber, knowing that within hours, this all important mission was about to take place.
Learn something from that, GOP!

Great news.....But now US Government should learn that Pakistan is not our friend....its king of friend who will stab you in the back, any chance it gets....Wake up government.....Take care of Pakistan.....

I was at the World Financial Center on 9/11. Our evacuation from our building (after the first plane crashed) led us right onto West Street. There I stood and watched the horror unfolding at 1WTC. Then - right in front of us - the second plane crashed into 2WTC. As orange flame mushroomed out of the building, we all ran to try to get to a safe distance. From there, I watched as several innocent people fell or jumped to their deaths from 70+ stories up.

I am not one of the people on this comment board saying that we should be ashamed of ourselves for rejoicing. I'm rejoicing and I'm not ashamed at all. No wringing of hands here. No second guessing. No guilt. No, not one single ounce. I am overjoyed that President Obama and his team didn't flinch when the opportunity came to take out OBL. No, I will rejoice and sleep very well.
Wouldn't it the time to ask Pakistan for the 20 billion we have given them over the past few years and stop giving them any more money after lieing to us about Bin Laden's not being in their country.

I have only one question: when does the movie version of this raid come out?

Okay, maybe I have a few more questions, like, will Robert Downey Jr. play Obama?

Joke! Tee hee!

Seriously, this has been like some James Bond fantasy come to life. I can't wait to see it reenacted on the screen so we can appreciate all the hard work and skill and intelligence it took the Obama administration and our armed forces to put this together and pull it off so cleanly.

We should all be thankful that the beast is dead. There's a special place in hell for people like him. He didn't discriminate. He killed muslim and non-muslims alike-men, women, children-their deaths meant nothing to him.
Although I didn't vote for him and may not in the next election we should give credit where credit is due to President Obama. And god bless our brave soldiers.

Reality is that those who vilified Obama for seeming weak, now praise him for killing. That speaks volumes about us.
I write the wrongs.

Seems like an endless cycle of violence. There is no winner here. Both sides continue to spend a significant part of their time, people and resources in fighting. Just imagine what could accomplished by the master planners of both sides, if they had sought to improve the lives of their people.

“Bin Laden was not a Muslim leader; he was a mass murderer of Muslims,” He was a leader of the Mukmineen. He was a leader of the Mujahideen. What is the number of Muslims killed by the Western soldiers (NATO & others)in Iraq, Afghanistan etc? Anyone?

President George W. Bush took a bullet for this country and it should never be forgotten. If not for his legacy, our current administration would have aborted this mission. In this over complicated world memories grow shorter by the day and soon we'll not be able to remember whom the for-fathers were or selfless intentions. Their continuing progressive disconnect will be the demise of America. He whom has made the “promise” and wore the heart and took the heat is truly the one that has fulfilled his promise. That is one President Bush made to us a decade ago. My hat is off to you President George W. Bush because you made a promise to America on the day you swallowed New York's City's and the rest of America's suffering down your throat, standing on a pile of rubble and putting America and peoples fear above your own. We saw and we'll never forget.

Thank You George & Laura, for the sacrifice you’ve made for our Country.
God Bless You and
Sincerely, Our Family

Alright. After viewing most of the comments it appears that Obama is a hero and is certain of re-election. Osama was obviously a guest of the Pakistani government for the last ten years. And, our Defense establishment is rejoicing because the, "war on terror", will continue for the rest of time. "We can't let our guard down now!"

All of the expense, and all the wars bankrupting the country for the past decade was virtually a complete waste of lives and resources. We should have stopped right after we put better locks on the flight deck doors.

The world will be a safer place when Western interests stop riding roughshod over other cultures..Everyone should be free to live in the world of their choosing,worship whichever god they decde will see to their needs and raise their children free from helicopter gunships and people whose main interest is taking any valuable resource they might have. Was Geronomo a terrorist?

jake at NYC wrote, "What does this actually change?"

Two things change:

1. The American people's unfinished business with OBL is done. Some measure of justice has been done for the thousands of people Bin Laden murdered in 2001. You may not care, but I do, and I think millions of people all over the world agree with this.

2. American credibility is restored. For years it seemed we could do nothing right in our "war on terror": Tora Bora, Iraq, Abu Ghraib, Guantanamo, Pakistan... now for the first time, we have delivered a blow, right under the noses of our duplicitous "ally" Pakistan. A blow that demonstrates that we will persevere, we will pursue our mission, to the ends of the earth if needed.

Well done, Mr. President!

I wish Obama was correct that the world is safer simply because we have killed bin Laden. No doubt he was, and *still is*, an inspiration to al Qaeda's followers, supporters, and members.

But al Qaeda is ultimately a set of beliefs and ideas.

Beliefs and ideas cannot be defeated by weapons or killing individuals.

Al Qaeda will only be defeated when new ideas that appeal to its followers displace and replace its existing belief system.

www.findingourdream.blogspot.com

I love reading the comments here.  If you want a good laugh, go to Fox News site and read the posted comments on any story regarding the death of OBL.   The conspiracy has started....if it wasn't so sad, it would be funny.

That is such a great news for US and its allies. We did it! But one question still remains as how can osama stay in a house next to a military academy and a town which is an hour from Pakistan's capital Islamabad? And still ISI failed to notice it? or they already knew about it but was busy making money by playing double game with terrorists and America!!!

God bless America!!!

Now that Bin Laden is gone, please stop the madness by pulling the troops home, so that their occasional heists taking them to headlines, will not be the fuel for further recruitment. Else Bin Laden's death will just be a symbolic achievement with no hope in sight to end the never ending wars. Let the smaller fisher rot. No use draining resources on them and that might help the economy as well.

With the man killed and the body in the sea, where's proof of Osama bin Laden having been killed or buried? All the people have is, still, all we had when Bush was in the White House -- his word for it, the media's word for it. Tall tales than turn on lies, lies no one can verify or deny. Bush all over again! Only now even more than back then, the people WANT to believe what they're told--to judge by the comments and the euphoria. Shame, shame, shame! A nation that respects and honors itself does not indulge in the celebration of anyone's demise. Regardless of who or what Osama was, what he did or did not do, it would have served better the already sullied image of a nation's credibility to have treated this man's death with far greater dignity, transparency and respect. It is to the victor's honor to treat the vanquished, dead or alive, with the dignity, honor and transparent honesty due himself!

No, do not expect peace nor any manner of justice to come from actions such as this. The path of blood and violence only leads to more and more blood, greater and greater violence. This is not over yet, nor can it be for a time to come. Yes, indeed, the bell tolls for thee, for me, for all of us in this sorry business!

May God bless America for its children's conduct belies such intent!

So Hamas is remaining neutral as the Syrian despot Assad murders his own defenseless people. It is standing on the sidelines as innocent Syrians are murdered. So why exactly are we expected to take the side of Hamas when Gazans are subject to a suffering much of which is ultimately self-inflicted?
